intro: Psephellus nogmovii, commonly known as the Armenian bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Armenia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils at high altitudes. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
